website_summaries.verdict: A unique BenQ desktop monitor designed especially for photographers and graphic designers.
pros: High quality 2K screen replicates colors more faithfully than traditional gaming monitors
Shading hood reduces the amount of glare on the screen in bright environments
cons: Embedded access ports like the USB port can arrive defective or stop working after a few months

website_summaries.verdict: BenQ's SW2700PT is a reasonably priced 27-inch monitor designed for photographers. It's an excellent performer and is packed with photo-friendly features.

customer_reviews.title: (original review) WOW!!!  (original review) but not so much now.
customer_reviews.text: (original review)"Why did I wait so long to buy this monitor? Great color, nice hood, love it. " (original review) Looked great -- but it is beginning the decent into what made me replace my Apple Cinema. A two inch smudge has appeared in the center of the screen. And likely it will just get worse and worse. My experience tells me I will tolerate this for a year or so and finally be forced to replace this monitor. Of course I need a monitor on a daily basis so I will not return this one. But I am quite disappointed. What I get for buying an unknown brand, I had never seen in use.
customer_reviews.author: Fred K

customer_reviews.title: Not sure about this company
customer_reviews.text: Love Amazon....This monitor was to be for my photography, however, two weeks after setting it up I had these wavy lines going across the screen. Rebooted and they went away. Two weeks later happened again. tried calling and emailing BenQ and could not get any response. A week later happened again. Tried to post a video but was too large to upload so a picture will have to do. I have tried over four days to reach someone to no avail. No response to email or phone calls. I would love to have this monitor but will not buy from this company again. Too bad, such a beautiful monitor when it works.
customer_reviews.author: The Perfect Image

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this monitor!
customer_reviews.text: This monitor will show burn-in and ghosting in a matter of minutes. I am on my third replacement and each and every one have had the exact same problem. I'm editing in Lightroom, or watching a movie, and as soon as I close it, I can literally read the text burnt in to the black background. Save your money or buy a better product. As you can see in the screenshot I paused on a black screen for a movie but I Can still see all the movies I was browsing, burnt in to the screen. Eventually they do go away but are replaced by other burnt in objects depending on what is being displayed for any length of time.
customer_reviews.author: Rl78

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: Owned for less than 6 months. Turn it on one day and a big stripe running down monitor. I send it back and BenQ claims physical damage and won’t cover under warranty. This is ridiculous as the monitor stayed on my desk and never dropped or touched. Now I’m out $700 and no monitor. Never again will I purchase a BenQ product.
customer_reviews.author: Francis E. Buckley

customer_reviews.title: Dead pixels galore
customer_reviews.text: The screen was littered with dead pixels when I got it out of the box and plugged it in. Not just one or two, but a whole starry night’s worth of them. I’ve asked for a replacement and will update my review if I encounter the same issue with the next one.
customer_reviews.author: such.a.payne

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: As a photographer I was so frustrated with my laptop monitor, I even went out and bought a spyder which only furthered my resolve that I couldn't keep guessing my that image edits were ok & needed a new monitor. I kept having to upload my images to a gallery and check them on my phone to make sure they were accurate. It was horrible and time consuming. I threw in the towel and decided the BenQ was worth the price, and OMG the difference is amazing, so accurate right out of the box. I love it so far. My photo editing has been streamlined and its saving me so much time!
customer_reviews.author: Alyssia McCaslin

customer_reviews.title: This is the biggest waste of space you'll ever purchase!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a professional landscape photographer and I rely on color calibrated workflow. This monitor is a joke and so is the "Palette Master Element" color calibration software it comes with. The PME software is so clunky, I'd be pissed to use it on windows 95. When I did get it to "calibrate", it made my images look as though they were taken in a nuclear waste dump. And don't get me wrong, I've been color calibrating my systems for years...this POS has been putting a damper on my photography for months now. I haven't been able to make correct prints or anything. Try calling BenQ support?...hahaha. Good luck!!! DO NOT BUY!!!!! This is absolute garbage and I just wasted $1200!!!
customer_reviews.author: Torrey Voigt

customer_reviews.title: Deceiving Listing - NOT 240 Hz monitor
customer_reviews.text: This is the only reason I bought this damn thing. In the market for a 1440p 240 Hz monitor. It's listed right there. It says 240hz. Monitor is a Benq, so fine, it's great... But this is the second one I'm going to have to return for deceiving Amazon listings. Absolutely terrible waste of time..
customer_reviews.author: Michael S

customer_reviews.title: Worth the learning curve
customer_reviews.text: This took me quite awhile to get running how I want, but SO WORTH IT! There's a little learning curve. Once calibrated the picture is perfect (and dang close even before it's calibrated)... ADVICE: Remember what mode you're in! I toggle back & forth from Adobe RGB to sRGB a lot. I'm worried I'm gonna forget I'm in sRGB and get deep into an edit. CONS: It comes with a an install CD! SERIOUSLY!?!? I know I'm not the only one without a CD drive in this day & age... Used my old laptop & transferred it to a thumb drive... I'm sure you can download it too. Other than its out of date install disc, I LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.author: Scott Newton PhotoGuy

customer_reviews.title: Great Monitor
customer_reviews.text: I would have given this monitor 5 stars but I couldn't get the calibration hardware to work on my desktop. (Pallette Master Element that must be downloaded.) If I use my Spyder Pro to calibrate the monitor, the screen is very close to printing what I see on the monitor. Ben Q said they would take it back and either repair or replace but I didn't want to be without the monitor as I don't have another one to use while it was being repaired. Everything else works perfectly. For what this monitor costs I should probably have sent it back but I'm not going to...my choice.
customer_reviews.author: cragusa23

customer_reviews.title: Extremely impressive monitor
customer_reviews.text: I use this monitor primarily for photo editing. I hesitated buying such an expensive monitor, but could not find anything else with all the features I wanted. After using it for a couple of months, it is by far the best monitor I have used due to its solid (and heavy) construction, excellent brightness, wide color gamut, and 4K resolution. The Palette Master Element software provided works well with my Spyder 5 Pro colorimeter and is easier to use than other calibration software I have used.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Check Your Laptop Capability For 4K
customer_reviews.text: Maybe it was me, not sure, but I have a suspicion that there are many people unknowingly running 2K via their laptops and not understanding that just because it says "4K", it won't produce it if your computer doesn't have a capacity to do so. Spoke to BenQ and suggested some sort of Technical pop-up window that will tell a user whether their computer is optimized or not for 4K: they replied that their monitors don't have this detection feature and knew of none that did. Although, considering all the other capacity notice-screens that do pop-up, such a feature would be useful. Buying the 2K monitor they have instead to parallel my MacBook Pro.
customer_reviews.author: Michael E. Angell

customer_reviews.title: Seems like it could be great if you can get a good one.
customer_reviews.text: This monitor seemed like a top notch pick all around according to endless reivews all over the place, but the first one I got had a dead red pixel in the upper right part of the screen and noticable backlight bleed in two places. Its replacement had much less noticable backlight bleeding, but a dead pixel in the lower right part of the screen. I am currently waiting for the third one, but don't have high hopes. For a monitor aimed specifically at graphics and color professionals, any such flaws are absolutely unacceptable. Work on your quality control, BenQ,
customer_reviews.author: Dv1234

customer_reviews.title: Monitor holder is scratced, received used item.
customer_reviews.text: Waiting for the third replacement. First package came in a ripped and damaged box with a scratch on the monitor holder. The second was delivered with a heavy dent on the box, I did not even open it. I am not going to use a such expensive equipment that came in damaged package. Waiting for the third replacement...
customer_reviews.author: Olena

customer_reviews.title: Nice monitor, but with lots of bleed
customer_reviews.text: I liked the monitor other than the amount of backlight bleed. If I'm going to be spending close to $800 for a monitor, I want to be completely satisfied, which I wasn't. The Amazon return process wasn't too bad, other than waiting for the refund to be processed. Finally, after a lot of research I've found that adobe RGB is a bit overkill for photographers; 100% srgb should be all that we need.
customer_reviews.author: Gustav

customer_reviews.title: Jury Is Still Out
customer_reviews.text: Got the BenQ SW271 for my photography work. Calibrate and matched to second monitor with Sypder5 Elite. The SW271 tends to run a little dark so a small adjustment brings it to my liking. The only issue is I have had intermittent flashing of random pixels. Not sure what is causing them. Using the BenQ website I sent support a message with photos. That was six weeks ago and have not heard back. That said, for whatever reason the monitor is now behaving. The episodes occurred over a five week period but, knock on wood, all is good. Wish I knew what made the difference.
customer_reviews.author: Verne

customer_reviews.title: Superior Photo Editing Monitor
customer_reviews.text: This monitor is fantastic for Lightroom, Photoshop, etc use. The colors and detail are what I needed. I'm no longer worried about rendering very large prints. The setup and calibration are straight forward -- aside from the brightness all calibrations were on the mark from the factory. If you are concerned about monitor calibration and changing ambient light something like x-rite i1 and the included hoods are for you. I wish I'd got this monitor as soon as I got serious about photo editing.
customer_reviews.author: M&J

customer_reviews.title: Terrific monitor for photo editing and viewing.
customer_reviews.text: This monitor will surprise you. I can see things now that simply were not visible on older, regular monitors. If you want perfect image reproduction, and the advantage of AdobeRGB color palate, this is the monitor to buy. It is very user friendly, has ample user adjustable parameters, and the puck controller allows swift and easy toggling of settings. This monitor performs to a very high standard, well better than the price implies.
customer_reviews.author: Lynxcrik

customer_reviews.title: Great with minor nuisances
customer_reviews.text: Pros: great color rendition Cons: It frequently needs to be reset, eg. turned on and off, after restart or boot-up to prevent the screen from blinking on and off as well as avoiding random white lines across the screen. However, despite the nuisance of occasionally turning the monitor on and off to reset certain problems, I would buy it again. The price and color rendition is just too good to avoid. I wish there was a 4.5 star rating.
customer_reviews.author: W. Gipson

customer_reviews.title: I really wanted to love this monitor, but . . .
customer_reviews.text: The monitor arrived and would not calibrate via the included Palete Master software using a verified and recognized Spyder 5. After many tries I called BenQ support, which was very good by the way - quick to respond and understood Photography - they had me run some tests and said that unit needed to be returned as it had a hardware defect. Interesting that I could get it profile almost perfect with the Spyder software (just not the BenQ software) but I was suspect about the hardware and at this price point wanted it to work right. I returned it to Amazon. I can not say enough good things about the support department and the professionalism of the staff.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Farrell

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for photo editing
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to edit photos from my Nikon D850 using photoshop and lightroom. I love the monitor, the colors are sharp and clear. I also love the detachable wheel that will change the color profile and navigate the menus. All in all a great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: jovial

customer_reviews.title: Great Monitor
customer_reviews.text: I needed a monitor primarily for high end architectural photography and video projects. Coming from referencing between multiple monitors, this has saved me time and allowed me to get color accurate images from the jump. I don't normally write reviews, but I had to because what I find upsetting is paying all of this money for a monitor and it came with a DisplayPort cable that did not work, even after a couple of hours of troubleshooting. I spent about a week after delivery using HDMI. I had to spend another $15 on a new one, plugged it in and it worked instantly. For this I reduced a star.
customer_reviews.author: Flip

customer_reviews.title: It could be great if it worked
customer_reviews.text: The only visual display on the monitor was No Cable Connected. Even after I tried 3 different HDMI and 2 DP cables, switched to a second computer and retried the cables I received the same results. I still feel BenQ can produce a great monitor and may give them another chance but a different model.
customer_reviews.author: EFS

customer_reviews.title: wanted to love it but
customer_reviews.text: really wanted to like this because I love love the puck feature... but it simply did not deliver enough color accuracy out of the box to warrant the price and clunky build of the monitor. the color profiles appeared strikingly off from my already color calibrated 4k monitor. the mac setting looked nothing like my mac screen... the base seems way too large for the size of the screen (it sat next to another 27 inch with a much smaller base on my desk)... unless you seriously need adobe rgb (which most don't), my advice is to go for a 4k 100% srgb instead, clearer picture than this 2k res and you'll save cash.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Works great for me.
customer_reviews.text: With any monitor there always tons of complaints, but I have to say this has been nearly flawless for me. Right out of the box with no driver installed it showed nearly perfect color and gamma. I haven't even gotten around to calibrating it yet; it works so well as is. There's one single dead pixel, thankfully toward the bottom, but I can't imagine getting a better monitor at this price. FWIW, I was initially worried that this monitor was too big, but now I'm SO glad I got this size.
customer_reviews.author: Mobius Strip

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely perfect for video and photo editing.
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for the perfect photo editing monitor, and this is it (as long as it lasts, which is yet to be determined). The price is good, the size is great, the resolution is perfect (not too much like 4K and not the old 1920), and the screen has nearly no glare. The stand is awesome, the build quality is fantastic. What else can I say, it's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Ernest Thompson

customer_reviews.title: SW271, if you plan to use displayport
customer_reviews.text: This monitor supports DP1.1 and DP1.4 but your cable and video card must be all matched. My geforce card is DP1.4 but the cable wasn't so no signal was detected by this monitor. The DP cable comes with this monitor seemed to be 1.2 so it become very unstable. 1 start taken out Update: the SDcard reader in the back is very difficult to access, I have to give up using it. 1 start taken out.
customer_reviews.author: Jaegersen

customer_reviews.title: BenQ SW2700PT Overall a good monitor.
customer_reviews.text: The monitor was great for the first 5 months then the screen started flickering but only when on the display port. Benq support made it easy to get a new monitor (easy but long about two weeks of back and forth emails ) Overall a good monitor but we will see if the new one last longer. I will update review if there is a problem with the new monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Meditatedstone0

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor,  bad customer service
customer_reviews.text: Its a great monitor, the best color rendition I've ever seen . Unfortunately the monitor came defective, it has a small light bleed in the lower edge. I am still waiting to get a replacement from Amazon. I contacted BenQ and all they offered was a repair by sending it in and waiting for it to be returned. Thats not ok with me.
customer_reviews.author: Franco

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality monitor
customer_reviews.text: My Eizo monitor finally needed to be replaced, and I didn't want to dish out another $2,600 for another Eizo, so I decided to give this one a try. I'm really pleased with its image quality and color accuracy. I only use it for editing photos so I can't speak to gaming, but this is an excellent quality monitor. All the cables you could want, and no dead pixels. The monitor has been solid in it's first month of heavy use.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie D

customer_reviews.title: Top notch for photo editing
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement for a Dell 2407 that I use for photo editing. I didn't think 27" would be much of an improvement but the greater width allows me to keep open panels in lightroom while editing and 1440px gives me a pretty good image view. Color accuracy is top notch. This monitor far exceeded my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Chuong N. Doan

customer_reviews.title: Really good
customer_reviews.text: I'm a amateur photographer and drone operator so color accuracy is very important to me, which is why I chose this monitor after researching for months. The color accuracy right out of the box is really good with a nice percentage of the color gamut available for display. I've had it now for 3 months with no problems. I did perform a calibration but only needed to tweak a few things to where I need them to be, but they were minor adjustments. There are other monitors out there but this one held the best value for me over all.
customer_reviews.author: jbrand

customer_reviews.title: Great just a great monitor. A really good one
customer_reviews.text: This is a great monitor for my Photography. I love the color adjustments to balance my pictures. To tell the truth I threw my phone at the monitor this replaced. It just frustrated me so bad, and it was not the first time. If I knew I could get such a good monitor I would have retired it a long time ago. It would saved me a lot of aggregation and probably made my pictures a lot better. Thank you for such a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas H Yost

customer_reviews.title: Good quality bad color retention
customer_reviews.text: The quality build is good. However, it does not retain corrected color for extended periods -reverting to a greenish hue after only minutes of use and even after calibration using a Spyder X Pro as well as Palette Master Element.
customer_reviews.author: BurgundyRam

customer_reviews.title: serious issue when using displayport
customer_reviews.text: When using the monitor with displayport connection, this display frequently goes to black for one or two sec, and then goes back to normal no such issue when using hdmi Have changed 4 dp cables, two of them are vesa certificated also, have done updated the graphic card driver and the vbios, but the issue still remains. The displayport 1.4 will be the only way on this monitor to get in a 4K 10bit RGB signal, and it has such annoying bugs. So I'd say, don't buy this monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful
customer_reviews.text: I use this monitor for my photography work. It’s hardware calibrated so it stays in perfect tune. The colors are very close to what I’m printing. It’s a very expensive specialized monitor but incredible for photos.
customer_reviews.author: Howard Rubinstein

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Gaming and Editing
customer_reviews.text: Love this monitor!! Been using a regular monitor for video editing and have struggled to get the right look even with using the different color tools. The color on this monitor is absolutely fantastic! One thing I found out is that you will not get 2560 x 1440 with HDMI cable, you will have to use a Display Port cable. Videos and games are super crisp!
customer_reviews.author: Lefty_Biker

customer_reviews.title: Great for photo editing, acceptable for gaming
customer_reviews.text: My fiancee and I both use the monitor and have been very happy with it so far. She is a professional photographer and really enjoys the color quality. She hasn't reported a single issue. I have used it for gaming and it's all I need for my level of play. I doubt I would notice much of a difference going to a 1 or 2ms monitor. I'm no professional so as long as it looks good I'm happy and it looks great.
customer_reviews.author: You can call me Brian

customer_reviews.title: Great for Photo/Video colour correction, but it's not HDR
customer_reviews.text: Not the most intuitive monitor to use out of the box, you certainly need to do some tweaking depending on your use-case between the monitor settings and your computer output settings but once you finish with that, you'll get a decent image from it. Though a 10 bit display, it's max brightness and contrast levels don't even qualify it for HDR. Still, for what it does, it's good for the price.
customer_reviews.author: MohawkADE

customer_reviews.title: Straight out of the box amazing
customer_reviews.text: Warning......once you view your library in this screen you will be up night re-editing your previous work. Calibrated right out of the box!!!! AMAZING IT WILL MAKE YOUR FINAL PRODUCT BETTER REGARDLESS OF SKILL LEVEL
customer_reviews.author: Ellsworth Funk

customer_reviews.title: Excellent picture
customer_reviews.text: This was very easy to set up and use. The screen is a good size - doesn't take up excessive desk real estate but is big enough to do what I want with it. This is being used both for photos and as my everyday computer screen. Netflix has never looked better. My old screen looked good only if it was set up at the exact right angle. On this one the viewing angle makes little difference except in the extreme but who uses their monitor that way anyway?
customer_reviews.author: I'm in my shop

customer_reviews.title: beautiful monitor viewing
customer_reviews.text: I have not had a chance to use it for very long, but it is very nice right out of the box. I have not "tested" it to see if it is as technically color accurate as advertised. It looks great with my eyeballs though. To give a more thorough review I would need to wait a while longer. If I have the chance to update this review, I will.
customer_reviews.author: TJT

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor for photo editing
customer_reviews.text: The 27 inch version is perfect for photo editing. The color accuracy is amazing and the fact that it work with the Spyder Colorimeter is a major plus. I actually recommended this monitor to a number of photographers, 2 of which bought one and can't stop raving about it. Guess they forgot it was me that recommended it to them.
customer_reviews.author: NixImages

customer_reviews.title: Great color accuracy, easy to calibrate, hands down fantastic proofing monitor.
customer_reviews.text: I've had my monitor for around 6 months and it's worked fantastic. Color calibration is quick and easy (I use a ColorMunki Display and DisplayCal) and have absolutely no complaints about it. Color accuracy is spot on provided I do my part and calibrate as needed due to changing light conditions. Setting up the hood was a bit of a pain to get the last part or two snapped/clipped on, but all in all, 5 stars across the board.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Great Colors... and easy to profile
customer_reviews.text: So overall this is a really nice screen and overall I am very happy with it. There are a couple of minor issues. The small dial to program through the various set ups is not intuitive and not well designed. I do not know why they don't include a USB-C to USB-C cord in the box. It is listed as an accessory. There should be a warning so you can at least order at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: mark a. kay

customer_reviews.title: 4K is Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I love my benq sw271. The 4k is amazing and the color accuracy out of the box is good if you do not own a calibrator. i calibrated with x1display and color look amazing. I do sell prints of my work so color accuracy is important for my printing. I would highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon K.Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor for work, photo editing, etc.
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Wish it had speakers but otherwise a great monitor. Use it for work and for "enthusiast" level photography editing. Bought a spyder color corrector and it's amazing what a difference the monitor delivers with corrected color compared to the old flat screen tv I was using previously. Also like the shroud it comes with as well. Reduces glare tremendously. Easy to adjust height, switch to B/W on the fly. Great monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan005

customer_reviews.title: Great Value and Quality
customer_reviews.text: Works great and less than half the price of anything in its class. Use the hardware caliblation software from their site first and the regular profiling will have to do very little work and be more accurate. Nice hood is included which all competitors charge extra for.
customer_reviews.author: Tom in Tubac

customer_reviews.title: Works with my Mac
customer_reviews.text: I always had problems getting my Mac mini to work well with a monitor. The colors were always off and frequently had that purple color take over the screen, requiring a turn off and turn on to do a temporary fix. This monitor works great. Never purple pictures and great colors for my photo editing. It is not full 4K resolution but also did not break my budget, a good compromise for photo editing for my business web site.
customer_reviews.author: professor Lou

customer_reviews.title: Color reproduction
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with the ease setting the monitor up and the quality. I’m just starting to play with my photoshop and very happy so far.
customer_reviews.author: LAH

customer_reviews.title: I couldn't be more pleased.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use with Photoshop and light room. The colors are vibrant true and accurate. I couldn't be more pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Marty

customer_reviews.title: Amazing colors
customer_reviews.text: This is a great monitor. Colors are vibrant, and the ability to switch between AdobeRGB and sRGB is a great way to proof for web and color printing. I really wish I bought this earlier. Price is good, and quality is way above Samsung or LG of similar size. Definitely worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Obsidian

customer_reviews.title: Don't pass this monitor up
customer_reviews.text: The most amazing monitor I have ever used!!!!! I've been a professional photographer for many years, tried many monitors, this one is spot on. I use the colormunki for calibration.
customer_reviews.author: J. Green

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful image, great features
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for accurate beautiful color, this is your monitor. Have it next to an iMac 5K 27" and it holds its own next to that monitor. 5k would be nice, yet the color fidelity and quality is great. I like the way it looks better than the iMac since this display is glossy. Have it on an Amazon basics monitor arm, love it for my second screen. Might even get another!
customer_reviews.author: John Hanacek

customer_reviews.title: DOA, very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I was really looking forward to this monitor for my photo work. Unfortunately, it arrived with the DVI port loose and unable to detect a signal. After way too much tech support contact, I finally decided to return it. Looking at the one star comments here - and based on the tech guys' comments, this isn't unusual for the BenQ. A shame.
customer_reviews.author: Ed B

customer_reviews.title: Very nice!
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect right out of the box. The resolution and colors are excellent really, photographic grade indeed. It looks good and the handle at the top of the stem is good to have. The display is very responsive and fast. Nice to have the landscape/portrait rotation. Very satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: Arik

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality
customer_reviews.text: I am using this monitor for photo editing. So far, I feel that the image quality is everything I had hoped for. I use two monitors and now that I have seen the BenQ, I may be replacing my twice as expensive older unit. We will see.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Delivered quickly, easily calibrated.
customer_reviews.text: This is a specialized monitor and is useful for those wanting an easily calibrated (hardware) monitor. In my initial tests, the soft-proofs in Lightroom matched very well with prints from Costco. This is the first time that I have experienced such a good match. Just make sure to calibrate the monitor once it arrives.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Hutchings

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding display,  Hood is a real plus,  trouble free after a year.
customer_reviews.text: I use this monitor for photography and general computing. Nothing but good to say about it. I love the hockey puck control for instantly switching between RGB, sRGB, B&W, adjustments, and source. Would make the same decision in a flash.
customer_reviews.author: bill2

customer_reviews.title: amazing monitor
customer_reviews.text: A++ this monitor is amazing. for the cost it was really worth it. The only thing I was a little disappointed about is the fact there is no built in speakers. But we will make do with external speakers. The image quality is impeckable! Also wish it came pre-calibrated
customer_reviews.author: Kayla

customer_reviews.title: Works perfect as a macbook extension of the screen
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect as a macbook extension of the screen , good resolution I work a lot in photoshop and was very easy to setup, maybe there is something better out there but this product works very good.
customer_reviews.author: Rafael Navarro Grau

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding
customer_reviews.text: I was concerned about the negative reviews regarding color bleed on the edges and unevenness to the point where I contacted the manufacturer before this purchase. The monitor I received, however, was essentially perfect. Not sure, but perhaps over time they have addressed their manufacturing issues.
customer_reviews.author: Barry P. Jefferson

customer_reviews.title: Finally a good one!
customer_reviews.text: Some serious QA issues, but I was determined to get a good one. 3rd one was a charm. Had serious bleed issues in the corners on other 2. I just could not get over how bad it looked for a photography monitor and how bled into my photos. For the money, it will be hard to beat this one by the specs which was why I was persistent. Text also looks really good. For programming and photography, this is going to work!
customer_reviews.author: Dino

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Color Rendition but....
customer_reviews.text: This monitor has amazing color rendition. You don't realize what you're missing by working with ordinary, inexpensive monitors. However, I find myself experiencing eye strain sometimes with this monitor.
customer_reviews.author: The Buddhist Witch

customer_reviews.title: An amazing photo editing monitor!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome 4k monitor. 27” is the perfect size for my space. Purchased it because I wanted a 4k monitor with Adobe RGB capabilities and this fit the bill for my needs. Color is amazing. Lots of features and connections. I love the hot key puck. Came factory calibrated and hood is included.
customer_reviews.author: W. Powe

customer_reviews.title: The 4k picture is just fantastic.
customer_reviews.text: The instructions were a little confusing, but managed thru them and am very pleased with the quality of the 4k picture and the hotkey puck for changing color modes and dual screen mode (once programmed).More instructions on how to program gama-dual mode would have been helpfull. Only disappointment was not being able to use the color munki colorimeter with the pallette master software but I knew that going in. It is already calibrated out of box so I can work on right away.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Bedard

customer_reviews.title: Detail / color setting
customer_reviews.text: Great for photo editing images , didn't need 4K . 27 " sort of the standard for editing at 2K . The hood and puck add the work flow speed . Average user would be fine with the 24 inch unit . all over quality is impressive .
customer_reviews.author: Hans K.

customer_reviews.title: Best monitor I have used in years
customer_reviews.text: Best monitor I have used in years. The size and quality have totally impressed me. As an online photo lab I use a monitor heavily and this has been a good investment because the setup and quality control has been fast and easy making the accuracy skyrocket. Plan on buying more as my business grows!
customer_reviews.author: Robert H Carney

customer_reviews.title: Good monitor but documentation is bad
customer_reviews.text: Very nice monitor, easy to setup and easy SW/HW calibration using Xrite i1 color display pro/Palatte Master.. but how put things end to end and choose between HW/SW profile is tough and had to listen to several videos.. Still not clear how to swicth between the two..
customer_reviews.author: R. Kannan

customer_reviews.title: Great Monitor for Photo Editing
customer_reviews.text: A perfect monitor for photo editing, at a great price. I Just wish it had built-in speakers, microphones, and a front camera for doing digital meetings.
customer_reviews.author: Jerome Mcclendon

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Wow, what a monitor. I should know I've been a professional photographer for 30 years
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant!
customer_reviews.text: Highly accurate, brilliant monitor. Much less than many other color accurate monitors. Easy to set up. Great customer service.
customer_reviews.author: JBHP

customer_reviews.title: Best monitor I have ever used.
customer_reviews.text: This monitor has an incredible picture and is fantastic for photo editing. My vision isn't as great as it used to be and this has made a huge difference. At some point, I hope to buy another one which will add another desired layer for using Photoshop and Lightroom.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely great!
customer_reviews.text: I have only had this monitor for a few days but I absolutely love it. I have always used normal monitors for my photography so this was a huge improvement. I am thrilled with this and would recommend it to anyone that is in to photography!
customer_reviews.author: R. Story

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor for editing.
customer_reviews.text: Great monitor for photo editing. Colors are true. Easy set up. Light shade was a nice plus. Came with several cables that make it possible to hook up to any computer type.
customer_reviews.author: Rich Powers

customer_reviews.title: Light leaks and terrible vignetting, can barely see anything from the varying ...
customer_reviews.text: Shameful. Light leaks and terrible vignetting, can barely see anything from the varying tones in the screen. Returning as soon as i have time. Guh...I'm so depressed... I truly was excited to get this monitor after putting hours into research for a good monitor for photo retouching purposes... just to be sorely whole heartedly disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding
customer_reviews.text: This is an expensive upscale monitor. After several months of use I can readily recommend this for photo editing. Exceptional function in Adobe Photoshop or light Room.
customer_reviews.author: TFCJR

customer_reviews.title: It's so pretty
customer_reviews.text: The color on this thing is amazing for the price. I have it next to an eyeQ monitor; both were color corrected. and the difference is unreal.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin Gray

customer_reviews.title: Sure it's expensive, but it's worth it.
customer_reviews.text: I love this monitor. The colors are very nice and easy to calibrate with my Spyder5 Elite. I no longer have a need for a 2nd monitor, as this one is large enough to act as 2 monitors if I need to work on documents side by side. The included shades that fit on the monitor come in handy when dealing with light that may be shining in from a window to the side. Overall, I really do like this monitor. Sure it's expensive, but I think it's worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Allen Clark

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality at a very good price for a Graphic Arts monitor
customer_reviews.text: Superior monitor. Beautiful accurate colors, excellent rendition of color spaces and for the price the best monitor for Graphic Arts workers out there without seriously breaking the bank.
customer_reviews.author: Cameraman5052

customer_reviews.title: this monitor is Wonderful! I've been editing photos with it and it's ...
customer_reviews.text: Man, this monitor is Wonderful! I've been editing photos with it and it's just really really nice to work with.
customer_reviews.author: Julio

customer_reviews.title: This is the one!
customer_reviews.text: Great, even color. Excellent dynamic range. Performs as advertised. After returning an ASUS and DELL, this one blew them both out of the water.
customer_reviews.author: L. Arthur

customer_reviews.title: Super monitor.
customer_reviews.text: Love the quality and the colors of this thing. Great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: T.Lee

customer_reviews.title: Amazing monitor for working / color grading, facts.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing display for color grading. Worth the price in my opinion. One of the best brands, I bought it so I could color-grade my film myself. So many options to make it easy for you to calibrate too.
customer_reviews.author: David J

customer_reviews.title: I'm an enthusiast photographer and I love the jpeg renderings unaltered
customer_reviews.text: I'm an enthusiast photographer and I love the jpeg renderings unaltered. Had to purchase a new video board and cable to connect to my older desktop. Very bright and perfect colors.
customer_reviews.author: Dognut

customer_reviews.title: I love it
customer_reviews.text: My husband recommended this monitor after a bunch of research. With me being a photographer I needed a monitor that was color calibrated. For any fellow photographers I would recommend this monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Autumn N. White

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!!!
customer_reviews.text: Blown away by the quality of this 1440p monitor. Perfect for photography and color grading videography projects!
customer_reviews.author: Eric R.

customer_reviews.title: The adjustments are easy, and I am able to match the colors ...
customer_reviews.text: I should have purchased this quality of monitor years ago. The adjustments are easy, and I am able to match the colors on both the monitor and printer.
customer_reviews.author: RonJ

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe the absolute clarity of this monitor. Although it is only 2D, it is brilliant!
customer_reviews.author: Joe Hudspeth

customer_reviews.title: This is a wonderful monitor. After many iterations of trying other monitors ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful monitor. After many iterations of trying other monitors and seeing issues like light bleed, bad clarity, and inaccurate color representation, this BenQ monitor swept me off my feet.
customer_reviews.author: GardenMomma

customer_reviews.title: Sweet!
customer_reviews.text: I use it for astro image processing and need a quality monitor that holds calibration, and this does.
customer_reviews.author: Dean Schwartzenberg

customer_reviews.title: bright
customer_reviews.text: Purchased it to attach it to Macbook pro for photo editing. It does a nice job.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: hmm the screen is amazing. in build
customer_reviews.text: hmm the screen is amazing. in build, in looks, in specs, i love it i want to keep it BUT... the magic word 'uniformity' that keeps popping up in every review for this screen. you get a good one or a bad one. my screen is literally split in the middle - left side is too orange, right side is blue-ish. you put a white background across the screen and you see it and it's sad. now i have to pack the screen, send it back and break my head if i should order another one hoping for a better result or just give up... hmm, i envy you guys who got a good model
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor before it died
customer_reviews.text: It was a great monitor, but then stopped working about a month after purchase. Almost 3 weeks after I put in a warranty claim, I still don't have a working monitor. EXTREMELY poor customer service from BenQ.
customer_reviews.author: Jay M.

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor!
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful picture (97% of adobe rgb after calibrating mine), and no dead pixels! The stand is kind of bulky, you may want a vesa mount.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for the money!
customer_reviews.text: Great picture quality and accuracy for the money. More features than similarly priced Dell monitors. Only downside was that it took ordering 2 to get a good one. The second one lived up to my expectations and other online reviews.
customer_reviews.author: John Blessing

customer_reviews.title: Really awesome
customer_reviews.text: Really like this monitor I didn't get the accuracy it claimed but my lighting conditions were not ideal
customer_reviews.author: Daniel R. Graham

customer_reviews.title: Lemon!
customer_reviews.text: Defective. The monitor I received failed the calibration tests, had a reddish cast over the left half and glowing dead pixels in the center. BenQ CS was - too say it mildly - not helpful. Returned!
customer_reviews.author: Delfina

customer_reviews.title: Great TV
customer_reviews.text: Great TV - it works! After only two weeks of use, the console broke down. It's a pity.
customer_reviews.author: Inga

customer_reviews.title: inconsistent color accuracy from left to right, not good for photo editing
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this monitor and after calibrating I noticed a severe difference in color from left to right across the screen, left side being much warmer than the right. I contacted BenQ and they advised me to replace it with a new one, which i did. The second monitor had the same issue, very noticeable color inconsistency from left to right. As a professional photographer, I cannot rely on a monitor like this, so I am returning the second one also.
customer_reviews.author: michaelf64

product_meta.title: BenQ SW2700PT 27 Inch QHD 1440P IPS Photography Monitor | Aqcolor technology for Accurate Reproduction | Hotkey Puck Efficiency Boost,Black
product_meta.description: Style:27" QHD (factory calibrated)With stunning 2K resolution, the 27” BenQ SW2700PT monitor is equipped with 99% Adobe RGB, 100% sRGB, 100% Rec.709 color space coverage providing you with a wide range of spectacular colors to work with.
feature_bullets: 27 inch 2K QHD resolution with IPS Tech: exceptional clarity and fine detail, wide viewing angle
Aqcolor advantage: 99% Adobe RGB color space, 14-bit 3D look up table (LUT) and Delta E≤ 2, accurate color reproduction.
Efficiency Boost: hotkey Puck lets you easily switch between Adobe RGB, sRGB, and Black & White mode, or set the hotkey Puck buttons to the OSD settings of your choice.
Custom calibration: each SW2700PT arrives pre-calibrated with factory report, hardware calibration, palette master element calibration software; calibrate for a consistent color advantage.
Professional monitor capabilities: included shading hood minimizes ambient light, Advanced Black & White lets you preview B&W content in three preset modes.
Eye Care for comfortable viewing: zeroflicker eliminates screen Flicker, low Blue light filters harmful Blue light. Avoid eye strain and damage. Your eyes will thank you for using this Tech.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars469 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
